entry.content:
My First Post about Newly Learned Knowledge through TOEFL

Today’s listening lecture is about one of Saturn’s moons, Titan. Atmosphere on Earth has gone through a process similar to species’ evolution, from an oxygen-lacking atmosphere to an oxygen-abounding atmosphere. And one similar thing betweeen Earth and Titan is that they both have thick atmosphere, and thick atmosphere is one key element in life’s origin. From the background knowlege of physics I learned, to be specific, the Maxwell distribution law of molecular speeds, the greater an celestial object is, the harder for gas molecules to escape from the atmosphere. Titan is the largest moon of Saturn, so it is still possible for it to have thick atmosphere. It is hard to believe that Earth and Titan will share similarities becuase their distance to sun differs so much that light reaching Titan is only one percent of that reaching Earth. Therefore, there are liquid cycles on both objects, though, one is liquid water and the other is liquid methane.
Another similarity is that they both have volcanos which emit water, methane and ammonia. In the early stage of Earth’s atmosphere, it abounded with carbon dioxide, methane and ammonia. And it might be fimiliar to many people that key compounds in organic bodies involve amino acid, which needs the element N. So one magic is that once upon a time, Earth could provide large amount of ammonia which could form life later. Scientists nowdays are interested in researching the evolution of Titan’s atmosphere, which may shed some light on how life on earch came into reality.

entry.title: Recommended TED on 11172020
entry.content:
Today’s Topic Is About the Symbolism of Flags

Human beings, by instinct, like the sense of belongings. And in history, flags were often used as a way to unify some people who had the same interets as insiders. At the same time, people who didn’t belong to the group would be regarded as outsiders. There were always the effects of division as byproducts. And in many cases, outsiders were not simply regarded as outsiders but rather enemies and this led to some huge conflicts and war, for example, the Nazi German flags during the world war II. Besides, different flags have different degree of restrictions on members within the group. Take national flags as example. In China, if one expresses disrespect on the national flags, like scribbling on flags or burn flags in public, he/she would commit a crime regarding to the national flag laws. And in India, if a flag is not manufactured officially, the producer would face a violation on laws. Let’s have a look at the other end of the spectrum. United States, though, have laws on national flags, such laws are not feasible. The laws respect to one’s freedom on minds and cannot force someone to be patriotic. Hence the law which forbiddens use of national flags as costumes and phenomena of players in Major League Baseball having figures of national flags on their back.
How to use flags propriately to represent a group of people and avoid regarding outsiders as enemies is an open questions. And it is not limited to flags. Anything which can represent one’s belongings also counts. Take me as an example, every day, I can see national flags, my university’s emblem, student association’s emblems and so on. In most times, members in a group, or some leaders, per se, won’t arouse their hatred towards the outsiders. But in some extreme conditions, some leaders may utilize flags not just as flags but as weapons to declare and try to win a war. Under such circumstances, members need to be concious about whether the war is what most members really want and a step back with thorough thinking can slow down the process of using flags as weapons. Also like the handling after the world war II, such behaviors should be punished and those flags need to be banned. Besides, teach later generations about the whole histroy in case that such tragedy won’t happen again, at least within several generations.
At last, I also agree to the idea that humans now need to look out of the concept of nations. We need to unify and cooperate as human beings. We are the same species and we share the earth. Bon’t be misled by some propagandas which declare that nation’s interests are always in correspondance with citizens’. Just like members in any group, one need be clear about the facts that sometimes nations’ behalfs are only the leaders behalfs, maybe they want to do something great to satisfy their sense of achievements, maybe they want their names to last forever. We also need to be clear that sometimes what leaders say won’t be what they will actually do.

Today’s Topic Is About Competitions among tech companies in China and United States

Along with the trade war, there are other concerns about the equity of competition among tech companies. The first is local protectism. Because of the great firewall in China, some glocal applications like facebook, google and twitter cannot enter into the market in China, but on the other side, some Chinese apps like tiktok enter into the United States market and obtain lots of users and make a fortune. The second is the safety and privacy of users’ data. Whether Chinese companies obey the same rule about data safety with United States is still in concern, and without doubt, a company having more data about users can better predict their bahavior. Besides that, by showing different content to different users, like showing some racism things to racists, the company can influence users’ thinking and control some critical events like elections to a certain degree, for example, facebook’s scandals on interfering elections on 2016. The third is the freedom of speech. Obvious people in China and United States have different degree of freedom to say, and companies in these two countries put different amount of efforts to sensor sensitive or illegal information. Discrepancies on values definitely bring about conflicts on people’s rights to say freely. The fourth is government’s involvement. China’s companies all need to follow the basic rules set by governments, including both the explicit and implicit rules. Undoubtedly, a Chinese company need to promise its functions for the nation prior to its own benefits. Although some are the same for United States companies, but the degree is different. Another involment of government is government’s grants for Chinese companies. So actually chinese companies are easier to lower their products’ price and win the competition. And sometimes their goals may not be maximizing their profits but other political or diplomatic goals. But whether grants are justified is hard to say, and in my opinion, if we look back the history, it is really hard for the following companies to beat up big companies which already control the market and win a reputation.

entry.title: Recommended TED on 11092020
entry.content:
Today’s Topic Is About Voting Systems

When people talk about democracy, they think of voting. At first glance, voting seems to be that every eligible person make his/her votes on each choice and specific organizations count the votes and declare the choice with most votes would be the winner. But this clearly ignore minority’s opinions and sometimes one choice’s advantage is not overwhelming compared to other choices. So large quantites of people’s benefits and opinions are ignored. The method above is known as plurality voting.
To solve the problem, some people suggest instant runoff method. Each person ranks each choice and then people compare the number of all people’s no.1 ranking. If one choice appears the least times among all the choices, then its votes will be transfered to the next choice on ranking lists of people who ranks this choice as no.1. And after the elimination of this choice, the remaining choices will go through the same process until there is one choice left. But the problem is that some people may cheat in the voting. If they know they are minority and their first choice will be eliminated and majority’s first choice is the worst for them among all choices, they will put a not that bad choice as their first choice rather than their most satisfying choice. Hence, such a not that bad choice may eventually beat majority’s first choice.
The third method is mutiple runoff. Firstly people arrange a runoff between the latter half of each person’s preference list about all choices. And transfer the loser choice’s votes to the winner’s and eliminate the loser choice. Repeat the process until there is one choice left. But this method is also criticized for people’s potential cheating as above.
The last choice I will describe is condorcet voting. Every two possible choices will face a runoff. And all people votes for these two choices and know people’s preference on the whole. After all comparison between two choices, people can know which choice wins the most times and regard this choice as the best choice for all people. That said, if there are 3 choices and A is prefered to B, B is prefered to C, C is prefered to A, then people cannot tell which choice is the best.
In fact, mathematicians have already proved that there isn’t any voting system satisfying a list of principles which reflect people’s expectation on a fair voting. And in different system, different people will benefit from such systems. Democracy and fairness are complex and from what we have learned right now, we can still devise a comparably fair system according to who are voting and what people are voting for.

entry.title: Reflection on 2020 Election in United States
entry.content:
As the associate press just announced Biden’s winning on elecion in 2020, the elecion thing is kind of settled down. Personally speaking, I still think Trump is still going to fight till the end because he will be face with lots of lawsuits after his losing power in the White House. But still Biden is most likely to get the power of presidency. In the whole process, I always paid attention to the circumstances in each state and the variation in odds in some big online betting websites which serve as additional information to help me understand the trend. Before the beginning of counting votes, I predicted that Biden would win Trump but wouldn’t exceed Trump too much, and Trump may not give up and use his advantages in the Supreme Court to grapple with Biden. But now, Biden’s advantages on votes over Trump is bigger than my previous thoughts. It seems less likely for Trump to take back his position in the White House, unless he is so determined to stir up a big mess and chaos in America. But even if he makes his final decision to put his all into the fight regardless of the aftermaths, some poerful men, like some leaders in Republican party, previously in his group may quit and try to prevent his crazy ideas in reture.
So the next quesion, what will happen if Biden becomes the president? What is going to change compared to Trump time? I guess he will rebuild relationships with Europe and south-east Asia. At least he will build stable relationships with traditional leagues. He is more mature than Trump and knows the secret to politics is to keep a balance and not be extreme in either way. And he will lessen some former extreme policies like building the wall between United States and Mexico. And I am happy with his winning on election. Although I am not fancy about that acedemic communication between China and United States can return to the level after 1978 (when China and United States recovered their diplomatic relationship) or the level in the second World War, but I still think academic communication through normal approaches can be easier than that in Trump’s period, say exchange programs, or unofficial foreign students’ pursuing on acedemic performances. And rebuild people’s belief in science and technology. He may also pay more attention on some global issues, like the global warming and its outcomes. And green energy will face faster and stronger development.
Some people said before that the new cold war is coming. I agree with this to a certain degree. I believe China will make greater progress in economy and military affairs than former competitors of United States, like Germany and Japan. And such progress will definitely cause United States’ attention and competition. But the cold war in 1950s was just after the world war II and international communication and cooperation back then was less extensive than those nowadays. With much more efforts it takes to wholly isolate two groups of leagues, the new cold war will be less colder than the former one.
But on the whole, I still hope the world will progress and different countries will be in cooperation more instead of conflicts.

entry.title: Economics-Ideas of Marginal
entry.content: This is the first posts about economics. I think one of the most significant ideas in economics is the idea of “marginal”. Maginal corresponds to the idea of “derivatives and differential” in mathematics. In real life, people won’t think on the whole but rather, they think about what would happen if they make a single choice or make a small difference. If a producer finds out produce one more products, he can still make profits. Then he will produce one more, if other factors like whether he is too tired to work, are ignored. Through this methods of “marginal”, and some quantification methods (quantifying and using parameters help us to dessribe details involved in making decisions more clearly), we can predict a person’s behavior to a certain degree. In conclusion, the effectiveness of your prediction depends on the completeness of your medels and the validity of your parameters. And one disapointing thing which should not be neglected is that there is no totally precise and robust models and systems.

entry.title: Recommended TED on 11012020
entry.content:
Today’s Topic Is About Shared Data to Tech Companies

Nowadays when we use an app or browing a website, there are always requests that for better experience, we should agree on the term conditions through which tech companies can collect our data. So here comes a question, whether we should be concerned about this? Big data or artificial intelligence can help us make decisions or know some details about ourselves, like,after we listen to lots of songs, some music application can help us understand our hidden music preferences and recommend more similar songs. However, only based on legal and moral use of technology, can technology play a more positive role in our lives. Algorithms might form biases about us and others like insurance companies, employees and police may adopt those biases. Algorithms may make mistakes and make wrong judgements about us because technology nowadays is not robust enough. The truth is that we now cannot avoid using digital equipment and those app and websites developer will definitely acquire our information. This is unavoidable with the development of IT. Government and the public should be aware that it’s our right to make sure our right is used properly, legally and morally. So those tech company should be monitored by the government or some critical data should be preserved only by the government. And from the view of history, tech companies collect information and through more information, they can provide more suitable survice for each individual and make more profits. So it is unrealistic to totally ban trades about information. The solution is to inform all users that the company’s technology, to be specific, those algorithms, are not totally robust, not totally precise about prediction, recommendation and profiling for each user. Company should tell their clients themselves, for example, by showing this piece of information at the start of apps or websites. They even need to provide their testing results of their algorithms (the same as medical companies should provide results of tests on effectiveness of medicine), like how precise their algorithm is to predict clients’ behavior and predisposition. If the data is so critical for each individual, companies would be forced by laws to open their codes to the public. Besides, the government also should spread the idea to the public that algorithms, at least nowadays, are not omnipotent. And government should try their best to make changes and requirements mentioned above happen.

entry.title: Reflection on the 3rd WORLD LAUREATES FORUM--Mind of Science
entry.content: Some sub-venues of the third WORLD LAUREATE FORUM was located in Shanghai, and my school provided access to some parts of this meeting. What impressed me the most is the laureate of Nobel Prize, Steven Chu ‘s talk on life choices, career choices and so on. His talk might have something to do with the location of this year’s sub-venue of physics, Shanghai. Most anticipants are Chinese and one critical thing, which I think is the key difference in Chinese school’s and America’s school’s atmosphere, most Chinese students focus more on career. So his talk on career choice was really relevant to the situation here compared to another laureate’s talk. Actually, although Steven Chu is a Chinese American, he could still get to know Chinese students’ thoughts about research or career because he got in touch with many Chinese students studying in America. Quote, youth is wasted on the young, end quote. When you are young, whether you would like to take risks. He did some what seemed dangerous to the young, like hundling chemicals. And he still chose to become a physicist in spite of the recession at that time. Doing research can make you live a comfortalble life if you are satisfied about wearing simple clothes and living a simple life. But doing research and making a lot of money is mutually exclusive. He have used his car for 19 yeras and he still hopes that be his last car. Even back in Stanford, the cradle for entrepreneurs, as a professor, he was encouraged by many people to get a startup, but he refused because he didn’t want to spare time on such things. To be happy, he thinks that firstly one needs to be able to share happiness and secondly, to have global empathy. In my opinion, different jobs are not equivalent regarding to their meaning to the world. On average, scientists acctually do the most sacrifice and contribute the most to the world, and this is why I always pay much respect to scientists. Not all the people are the same and not all people are suitable for doing research. But everyone can think of a way to contribute to others rather than just their own little circle. Don’t be drown in your Wechat or Facebook or anything, jump out, find what you like, stick on to it and make contribution not only to you, but to the outside of your circle.

entry.title: Recommended TED on 10272020
entry.content:
Today’s Topic Is About Resilience

Every now and then, people suffer. There are already tons of theories and therapies to help cure people out of the aftermath of those sufferings. But those guidelines are truly hard to follow strictly even for those experts who tell you to do these. So in most cases, we’ll find people use negative and short-period methods to get rid of sorrows, like drowning in alcohol. Compared to pretending nothing has happened, a better way is to live forward with sorrows, which can be eased by some helpful ways.
From now on, you don’t need to get stuck with complicated theories or some even worse outcomes warned to you by experts if you don’t follow their instructions. Just three key ways can help you get back to the driver’s seat and roll back onto your life.
First, it is essential to admit those bad things’ happening. Actually unfortune falls to everyone, and it’s true that the degree of unfortunes differs on different people. But admitting your miserable experience is still helpful in avoiding endless groaning about your sorrow and avoiding repeatedly asking why it falls on you rather than someone else. Admitting is the first step to live together with sorrow.
The second is to control your instinct. People are inclined to focus on bad results rather than happy results. This helps our ancestors to be cautious about dangers and successfully avoid them. But nowadays most bad results are not critical on our survival or not, so it’s time to control such instincts and the attention and energy spent on them. And there’s a good way to divert your attention to other things–think of three happy things each day. Sticking onto this habit can really make people grateful and positive towards life.
The last is to check whether each thing you are about to do is useful. Whether meeting the criminals is useful. Whether drinking one more bottle of wine is helpful. Whether staying up late all nights is helpful. Checking the whether your behavior is useful and justified can bring about great influence to all the corners of your life. Just like one of my teachers said before, the limits of speed of cars is not functioning of engines but performances of brakes. Thinking about the aim of each behavior and whether the behavior can really lead you to that aim can serve as brakes to avoid taking actions immediately and recklessly.This method is helpful not just in dealing with recovery of sorrows and unfortunes, but also in every decisions and every actions you are to make. If I had learner about it before, I wouldn’t do something meaningless, like staying up late playing gmaes, just to drain off my bad emotions. Actually such behaviors cannot bring me much peach and there are obviously better alternatives.
Just 3 methods can lead to a wholly different life. This can be applied to every emotional fluctuation brought by some unanticipated outcomes. Admittedly it is hard to follow them strictly every day, but even you can sometimes think of them, they still help a lot.

entry.title: Recommended TED on 10262020
entry.content:
Today’s Topic Is Required time and process to produce vaccines

Since the outbreak of covid-19, tens of millions of people have died and world-wide economy has been drastically influenced. And because the death ratio is not that severe as SARS-CoV and won’t be affected by high temperature in summer, covid-19 can more easily speard over the world infecting more people and causing more damage. Now people around the world are waiting for the appearance of effective vaccines to control this disaster. However, to divise an effective vaccine is not that simple. It should follow a strict processing rules, firstly laboratory research, secondly clinical tests and lastly manufacture. Genarally it takes around 20 years to finish all these steps and get well-performed vaccines, meaning that they are resilient, long-lasting and don’t have many side effects. But under special circumstances, such as this well-spread infection, time on each stage can be greatly shortened by several parallel researches and tests going on simultaneously. This parallel process is most distinct during the first stage because there are many ways to devise a vaccine involving using weakened virus or taking out specific part of virus to serve as anti-body. So it is obious that this first research stage is the most creative part because there are many ways to weaken a virus biologically or chemically and to choose a anti-body part. There are several laboratory vaccines testable nowadays. But what’s disappointing is that only being testable is only the beginning of the whole process. The most time-consuming part is clinical testing. That needs to strictly follow certain orders. It’s also divided into three parts, phase one focusing on intensity of triggered immune ability, phase two focusing on the right dosage and delivery method of vaccines on wider population and phase three focusing on determining safety and potential side effects on people who are about to use. Lastly, manufacturers use different pipe lines to produce different vaccines because every vaccine uses different composition.
From all above, it is laborous and time-consuming to produce vaccines but collaboration can speed up this process.

entry.title: Recommended TED on 10252020
entry.content:
Today’s Topic Is About Steroids

This is my first post about science, to be specific, biochemistry. Although this is not my major, I am still fond of knowing more about it to help me live a better life. Steroids is most infamous because its usage on sports events, and atheletes, as well as rule makers responsible for fairness of sports, seem to get stuck into the “Game Theory”. Atheletes will use more complicated chemicals, which cannot be tested by current equipments, but it in reture stimulates the advance of testing equipments and techinics. But usage of steroids is not limited to this. Actually, it plays an important role in our bodies, which is evident regarding its own existance in our body. Steroids have one big advantage compared to other kinds of chemicals when serving as information to regulate gene expression in our cells. That is steroids can pass through membrane of cells, combine with some other chemicals in the cell and direct gene expression, instead of combining with some proteins on membranes and producing corresponged chemicals in the cell itself to influence gene expression. Going directly into the cell means faster influence. So some asteroids can help to ease acute disease. And because it can influence gene expression, which plays a role in immune system, asteroids can help to handle self-immune diseases, like rash, which means that your immune system begins to attack your normal cells. Asteroids can lower the immune system’s ablitiy and thus decrease the attack on your own cells. But such methods cannot help people get rid of what cause the overeacted immune alarm. If the alarm happens over and over again, then patients need to take long-term asteroids. But in reture, it will cause some side-effects.
In conclusion, asteroids play an essential role in our body by regulating our gene expression. Its usage is not limited to just stimulants, it is also active in controling your immune system as medicine.

Watch today’s recommended TED at: https://www.ted.com/talks/russell_wilson_my_secret_to_staying_focused_under_pressure?language=zh-cn#t-352801

People need to face anxiety, uncertainty and sadness when pressure confronts them. However, I don’t think nagetivity will always play a bigger role, and I think it’s hard to compare each’s impacts on changing the situation. Positivity can make you believe in yourself and stick on to your plan, which might be vital to your final victory, but it can also lead you into over-confidance and create the discrepancies between what you do and what you imagine. Negativety is better at letting you do most needed things to improve the situation, while it will also destroy your resolution if it is out of control.
At last, the speaker suggested you always switch to neutral and that’s also the common ground of the speaker and me. Just like driving a car, you always switch to neutral before slowing down or speeding up. Not too ambitious and positive nor too sentimental and negative, that’s the difficulty of balancing.

entry.title: Recommended TED on 10222020
entry.content:
Today’s Topic Is About Drugs Safety

Watch today’s recommended TED at: https://www.ted.com/talks/katherine_eban_a_dose_of_reality_about_generic_drugs?language=zh-cn#t-942332

Standards on drugs play an important role in guaranteeing public’s healths by setting requirements on drugs. By this way, experimental and clinical tests can distinguish effective and safe drugs from bad drugs, which may even bring severe side effects to patients. And FDA, as well as “generic drugs”, is aimed at setting such basic rules for drugs. It is clear that drugs safety depends on the effectiveness of these rules and process of executing. However, the system for testing drugs and whether the drugs meet the requirements of FDA, are based on manufacturer’s own conscience. To be specific, the administrater won’t see the results of experiments or tests themselves but rather see reports on those experiments. The lack of overseeing the experiments and checking the validity of data is making room for fake data. If the drugs can pass the test, then everything is okay. But if the drugs fail the test, manufacturer may fake their data instead of purifying their drugs to pass the test, and make their fortune by selling potentially uneffective to the world.
This news also reminds me of a movie about an Indian drugs manufacturer forged HIV drugs and sold these drugs to Indians or Chinese. However, in that movie, the forged drugs were as effective as real ones. Because the real drugs were protected by intelligence laws and were sold in high prices, most people could only buy forged drugs in black markets. At last, the manufacturer was arrested for violating the intelligence law, but the government decided to lend a helping hand to people by offering subsidies.
To ensure the safety and effectiveness of drugs, there are mainly two approaches. The first one is to make sure admistraters on drugs can actually see the process of making drugs and results of tests on drugs. The second one is to let patients know more information about drugs they use. Some basic facts like how the drugs are produced, where they are produced and results of tests should be shown to buyers and patients.

entry.title: Recommended TED on 10062020
entry.content:
Today’s Topic Is About Bias & Race

Watch today’s recommended TED at: https://www.ted.com/talks/jennifer_l_eberhardt_how_racial_bias_works_and_how_to_disrupt_it?language=zh-cn#t-850525

I’ve been thinking about bias and racial problem for a long time. And with development of parades for Goerge Floyd, racial problem comes on the table again. Personally speaking, I don’t think impressions based on one’s skin color, one’s family, one’s status, one’s appearance are not justified at all. Those things can serve as indicators of people to a certain degree. Of course, indicators mentioned above, to be more specific, all kinds of indicators, are not 100% precise. But from the view of possibility, behaving differently to different people based on their “indicators” is reasonable and rational, which can bring about greatest amount of averaged benefits(just like gaining greatest expectations in statistic problems in math). But in most cases, people won’t contact others only once, and they may encounter others repeatedly. Hence, the most idealized circumstance is that a person need to adjust his/her manners to others based on their following interactions afterwards. So when they first meet, one might hurt others’ feelings only based on, like, others’ race and skin color. But afterwards, with more communication, one probably realize that others are not the kind of people he/she thinks before. This is the first adjustment one should be aware of.
The second rectification is that one’s perception of others’ “indicators” should be “updated” to the “latest version”. It is common nowadays that some people still use outdated “version” of “indicators”, say, last 20 years’ version or even last century’s. This may be due to some people’s lack of updated information or not choosing to walk out of their thinking pattern and circle. If a person only get access to one kind of information, the information will reinforce itself and it’s hard for him/her to get out. To get rid of it, one need to know about more information from more sources and try to think a bit differently.
To be honest, these two adjustments are not easy for everyone. This is a complicated world. There are complicated circumstances. But to make it forward, I still think to help people get better education(not just learn to work out some math problems or to recite some articles or to know some basic knowledge in each subject) and to advocate more people to achieve these two adjustments mentioned above are essential.

Today’s Topic Is About History

Watch today’s recommended TED at: https://www.ted.com/talks/farish_ahmad_noor_why_is_colonialism_still_romanticized?language=zh-cn#t-725178
The speaker is a professor of history, especially on post-colonial subjects of south-east Asia. There are still huge conflicts about whether impacts of colonies are overall advantageous or disadvantageous. The professor, as well as I, thinks that we cannot embellish colonies as something benevolent or nice. The major parts of colonies are still dark and ruthless. In my opinion, cologial behavior is driven by profits and therefore, what colonizers did was not for residents in colonies but for their own benefits. When benefits of colonizers and residents came into conflicts, in most times, residents had nothing to do but surrender. It is undeniable that some settlers in colonies did something nice and kind, like helping sick local people etc, but colonization is evil and bloody in general.
All things happen for “history”. Colonization still has huge impacts on south-east Asia nowadays, like how local people represent themselves, what they think about their past and history, and how they interact with people from countries which colonized them in the past.
Jump out of box and have independent thinking. This is important for not only professors, but also each individual in society. Independent thinking helps to distinguish reasonable views between just rumors and to form one’s own history views and world views. Of course, to achieve this needs some reading and thinking. It doesn’t require people to become experts in related fields. Just be cautious about everyone’s ideas, even he/she is the most informative guy and compare different ideas about same issues. MOre acceptance on new ideas (not necessarily the correct ideas) and critical thinking help the society to get rid of stereotypes and move forward in history.

entry.title: Today's Recommended TED
entry.content:
This is the second TED talks I’ve recommended.

Watch the video through https://www.ted.com/talks/matt_trombley_the_beauty_and_complexity_of_finding_common_ground?language=zh-cn#t-476505

People are different. Typically, with similar interests, people can get together; with conflicting values, people will split apart. Most people always stay in their circle, holding their original beliefs and reinforcing their world views. But to achieve better relationships with more people, to get out of your comfort zone, you have to learn to negotiate and find common grounds with others. This is not easy for most times. It's easier to get rage and disagree with others than to calm down and have a thorough thinking about why others would think like that, why I would think like this and whether there are possibilities to live together without forced changes on either's beliefs. To find common grounds, the first is to show extravagent grace to others. "Extravagent" means that even if sometimes others' behavior offends us, we still need to keep calm and try to communicate. In this more and more divided world, people are easy to get into what is called AGONISM. If people love someone, they agree to all he/she does or believes. If people disagree with someone, they hate or fear him/her. Only based on common grounds, can people calmly discuss with others and try to understand. And only with grace rather than explosion with anger, can people try to find common grounds. Lastly, we still need to be cautious about the degree of tolerance and grace. Single or several unconcious offenses can be tolerated, but intentional, frequent and illegal offenses need to be handled through laws.

entry.content:
So this is my first post. If you want to know more about hexo, learn it from https://hexo.io
Use markdown’s format to generate my first blog.
‘’’ bash
$ hexo new “fill in your post name”
‘’’

Summaries in Today’s TED

Today’s recommended TED is about how to live with uncertainty (watch more on https://www.ted.com/talks/shekinah_elmore_the_courage_to_live_with_radical_uncertainty/up-next?language=zh-cn). The speeker, with genetic mutations on immune system, has lived with cancers, to be specific, not just a single cancer, since her childhood. The greatest uncertainty, I mean, to all people, is when your life will come to cease. You don’t know whether what you do everyday will make a difference in the future because you may just have to stop sometimes. You can stay where you are and do nothing; or do what you want to do the most right here and right now. You are left with only these two choices. Think more about it, and you’ll find, the best choice is to stop the uncertainty interfering your own life and just be yourself, do what you want, become whom you want to be and strive for it. Whether you come to your goal fast or not does not matter, and what matters is that you want your each day meaningful and progress towards your goal.
Besides, there are also great distinctions between American and Chinese doctors’ methods, attitudes towards patients, especially patients with cancers. Less respect on patients’ desires and too much efforts on therapy itself sometimes make Chinese doctors utilitarian and cruel. There must be some reasons underlying the comparatively tense relationship between doctors and patients. To correct highly utilitarian atmosphere in medical fields, it is a long way to go.
